events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection, causing significant front-end damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of vehicle collision.
A claims agent specializing in vehicle incidents was assigned to handle the customerâ€™s accident claim.
The insurer acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the customer about the next steps in the process.
The customer was asked to provide a police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
The customer promptly submitted all requested documents including the official police report and repair quotes.
The assigned agent began a detailed investigation of the accident circumstances and vehicle condition.
The investigation was completed confirming the collision details and verifying the extent of the vehicle damage.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and additional damages documented.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the timely response and proposed settlement amount.
The claim received official approval and the settlement plan was finalized in favor of the insured party.
The agreed payment for the vehicle repairs was issued to the customer's designated account without delay.
The claim was officially closed following successful settlement and confirmation of vehicle repair completion.
All documents and details related to the auto accident claim have been securely archived for future reference.
